page.title: 15THE MASON'S ARMS, WICHENFORD
page.content: The{Mason's Arms}is a{Banks's}pub tenanted by{Mr. and Mrs. Mountford. It is a quiet pub with sometimes only 20 customers in an evening. On a good day 150 people drink and socialise there. Most trade is{regular,}and bar snacks are served, but not full meals. There are both{darts}and{cribbage teams which compete in{Derbies}against teams from{other local pubs. {Special events}which take place at the Mason's Arms include a{Boxing Day}meet of the{Worcestershire Beagles,}twice yearly{Morris Dancing and;}in February the last meet of the{Worcestershire {Hunt}setsoff from the Mason's Arms. For the publicans, the working day is long,10.30 am to 2.30 pm and 6.00 pm to 11.00, and sometimes even midnight. Their living routine is unusual, and they rarely have a holiday; but they thoroughly enjoy the life.
